speaker: Upper Slopes
lines: Snow thins to scree and black ice. Old bones sit where the wind left them.
A broken cart half-swallowed by drift holds rusted picks and a prayer board.
The sky is a lid of pewter; even ravens keep low here, riding ground heat.
Frost feathers grow from iron nails hammered into a stump long ago.
Your hands remember warmth by memory more than sensation now.
Somewhere above, a bell rings once without a clapper.

choices.text: A roar from a ledge above—stand fast.
A horned shape cuts across the ridge—challenge it.
Pick your way toward the summit shrine.
